items.content_html:
Update the description of the window.fetch() page to detail that a TypeError throwed by fetch can be a NetworkError, and possibly a CORS-linked issue.

Summary

Update the description to detail that a TypeError throwed by window.fetch() can be a NetworkError, and possibly a CORS-linked issue.

Motivation

Reading the MDN page I was under the impression that Fetch would never throw as long as the arguments were right. It would have helped me to know that network issues, and CORS specifically, could result in a throwed error.

Supporting details

Sample test code:

const uri = "https://xxxxxxxxx.com/test.pdf";
try {
  const response = await window.fetch(uri, {
    method: "GET",
    mode: "cors",
    credentials: "omit",
    cache: "reload",
  });

  if (!response.ok) {
    throw new Error("Fetch fail");
  }
} catch(e) {
  console.error(e);
}

Resulting error log in Firefox devtools console:

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: chore: update desc of possible window.fetch() exceptions

Reinventing the wheel by using array.sort with a custom comparator function to sort the results of a query seems redundant, since there is already a built in method to sort the results of the query

items.content_html:
Bumps boxen from 5.0.1 to 6.0.0.

Release notes

Sourced from boxen's releases.

v6.0.0

Breaking

  • Require Node.js 12.20 (#67) 8747277
  • This package is now pure ESM. Please read this.

sindresorhus/boxen@v5.1.2...v6.0.0

v5.1.2

  • Don't trim whitespace in input text needlessly (#63) 760e247

sindresorhus/boxen@v5.1.1...v5.1.2

v5.1.1

  • Fix a regression (#61) 82291e8

sindresorhus/boxen@v5.1.0...v5.1.1

v5.1.0

  • Add title and titleAlignment options (#59) c50dad6

sindresorhus/boxen@v5.0.1...v5.1.0

Commits
  • 79651fe 6.0.0
  • 3c0a9b6 Meta tweaks
  • 8747277 Move to ESM (#67)
  • a5cfc85 Fix typo (#66)
  • 84d24fe Fix invalid escape in test string (#65)
  • badc4bc Welcome @â€‹Caesarovich as a maintainer
  • 724f59c Rework tests to use snapshots (#64)
  • f227da7 5.1.2
  • 760e247 Don't trim whitespace in input text needlessly (#63)
  • dff6c30 5.1.1
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

Changes for Checkbox_radio_button example to conform to the rule stated at the top of the page (i.e. elements, when all radio buttons with the same name value in the form are unchecked) that is we need more than one radio button in order to see the effect. Moreover, minor changes have been made.

Note: regarding the Checkbox_radio_button example I'm not sure whether changes I've made are enough or should it also be changed in some external example that is used by {{EmbedLiveSample('Checkbox_radio_button', 'auto', 50)}}. Any help would be much appreciated.

items.content_html:
This CSS property was added in FF89 but is not mentioned in the release notes:

  • Added release note
  • Removed from Experimental features
  • Verified BCD is correct
  • Removed dev-doc-needed - perhaps prematurely

Fixes #9349

What is missing from a normal docs release is the checkbox item "Docs are adequate".
IMO they are not adequate - I have done minimal "fixes" but I am hoping perhaps someone else proper job or suggest how this might be done.

How this works docs are old and out of date. All the essential ideas are there but it firefox specific and it is not clear what ended up happening from those docs. It all needs to be updated with the current state of play.

@rachelandrew is the expert, and already wrote a blog on this that is linked.

Specifically:

  • aspect-ratio
    • is documented and cross links to useful additional documentation
    • the example is simplistic. It would be useful to pull in a brief explanation of what you need to do for this to be useful - ie when would you set it or not set it. There is an implication that you need to set the box width and height attributes in HTML in other docs but that is not clear.
    • The section mapping_width_and_height_to_aspect-ratio seems to imply that you don't have to set this aspect-ratio on most browsers but it is worth spelling that out. It may be that someone more expert would infer that.
    • In summary, it would be worth some of the info from the linked doc coming into this doc.
  • Mapping the width and height attributes of media container elements to their aspect-ratio - this is supposed to provide the answers to why aspect-ratio is important.
  • It was written early in the spec
  • It refers to properties like intrinsicsize which do not appear to have got into spec - but may have made it in as contain-intrinsic-size
  • There is a statement that this only applies to img in FF - https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1583980 - . FF states full support so it is probably not true anymore.
  • All I have done for this is removed a little FF versioning and linked to aspect-ratio.
items.title: CSS aspect-ratio: add to FF89 relnotes and remove from exper. features

items.content_html:
Digest header is not related to Digest authentication.

Summary

  • Align content with Digest spec
  • improve wording around representation data

Motivation

Align content to spec

Supporting details

https://github.com/httpwg/http-extensions/blob/main/draft-ietf-httpbis-digest-headers.md#concept-overview states

This specification does not define means for authentication, authorization or privacy.

Metadata

  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Digest does not cover authentication

items.content_html:
Summary

Adding SubmitEvent and FormDataEvent to the list of those inheriting from Event

Motivation

These two are currently missing from the Event list. Per HTML Spec, SubmitEvent and FormDataEvent inherit from the main Event and should be listed.

Supporting detail

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#the-submitevent-interface

Related issues
